clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Solving Jigsaw Puzzles on Visuospatial Cognition in Older Adults: Jigsaw Puzzles As Cognitive Enrichment

brief_summary.textblock: Meta-analyses indicate beneficial effects of cognitive training and cognitively challenging video games on cognition. However, cognitive effects of solving jigsaw puzzles - a popular, visuospatial cognitive leisure activity - have not been investigated, yet. Thus, the primary aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of solving jigsaw puzzles on visuospatial cognition. As secondary aims, effects on psychological outcomes (self-efficacy, perceived stress, well-being) and visuospatial everyday functioning (instrumental activities of daily living and self-reported cognitive failures in everyday life) are examined.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in global visuospatial cognition from baseline to post intervention
primary_outcome.description: Averaged score of eight z-standardized visuospatial cognitive ability scores (see secondary outcomes 2 - 9)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in visual perception from baseline to post intervention
Change in visuoconstruction from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Copying in Complex Figure Tests; parallel versions for baseline and post-test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mental rotation from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Mental Rotations Test-Letters (2D) and Form A (3D)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in visuospatial processing speed from baseline to post intervention
Change in visuospatial flexibility from baseline to post intervention
Change in visuospatial working memory from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Block span (Wechsler Memory Scale, German version)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in visuospatial reasoning from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Block design (Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-III, German version)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in visuospatial episodic memory from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Recall in Complex Figure Tests (sum score of immediate and delayed recall); parallel versions for baseline and post-test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in psychological well-being from baseline to post intervention
Change in self-efficacy from baseline to post intervention
Change in perceived stress from baseline to post intervention
Change in objective everyday functioning from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: TIADL (1-3): Timed instrumental activities of daily living (Task 1-3; sum-score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported everyday functioning from baseline to post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: CFQ (visuospatial items): Cognitive Failures Questionnaire, sum score of visuo-spatial items; German version

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in jigsaw puzzle performance from baseline to post intervention

intervention.description: Solving jigsaw puzzles 6 times per week for at least 1 hour over a period of 5 weeks.
Cognitive health counseling regarding modifiable risk and protective factors of cognitive decline and dementia at baseline and three telephone calls during a 5-week period for expert monitoring.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Examination â‰¥ 24)
- Commitment to minimum jigsaw puzzle time (1 hour/day, 6 days/week, 5 weeks)
- Interest in jigsaw puzzles
- Low jigsaw puzzle experience (less than 5 completed puzzles within the last 5 years)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Examination < 24)
- Participation in another interventional study
- Self-reported psychiatric, neurologic or other disease, which could affect cognitive change over time
- Self-reported, severe visual impairment or motoric impairment of the upper extremity which significantly affects ability to solve jigsaw puzzles
